sentences: Ta ei rääkinud sellest Marile ega Miinale.
Poiste rõõmul polnud otsa ega äärt.
Ta on korralik mees, ei joo ega suitseta.
Kas sul on täna sünnipäev või? – "Ega tea, äkki on ka."
context: "Ütlevad" is the third person plural present indicative form of the Estonian verb "ütlema", which means "to say" or "to tell". In the provided example sentence, it's used as part of a phrase where people are saying something: "They say that I am a good child." The word appears in contexts where someone is reporting what others have said, similar to English expressions like "they say", "people say", or "it is said that".
